subject: Re: [junit] Assert for files
msgSnippet: I think you have to write your custom assert class (or write your assertion in your TestCase, as you want).  See my previous post on a similar question

I think you have to write your custom assert class (or write your 
assertion in your TestCase, as you want).  See my previous post on a 
similar question (http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/4229).

You may also be interested in the patch that formats the output when 
comparing long strings (http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/4252)

-Vladimir
